newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine stocks pull back at close.
newsitem.headline: Argentine stocks pull back at close.

text.p: Argentine stocks retreated at the close Tuesday but traders shrugged off the drop as normal profit-taking.
"The bolsa surrendered some ground in late trading simply because it's consolidating with a little profit-taking," an analyst at a foreign investment fund said.
"I think prices will tilt higher again later in the week as more players return, encouraged by the strength seen on Wall Street," he added.
The blue-chip MerVal index shed 0.6 percent to 734.03, erasing most of Monday's gains.
Traders said Tuesday's auction of five-year local Bonte treasury bonds, which fetched interest of 8.78 percent, was successful and would help to underpin the market.
But they noted before rising the MerVal would have to overcome technical resistance levels.
"The MerVal faces strong resistance between 740-750 points and will need to establish a firm floor," said Jorge Bonanno at brokers Interfin.
Floor volume picked up to 22.3 million pesos from 20.7 million Monday, while over-the-counter turnover swelled to 111 million pesos from 70.2 million Monday.
The broad market eased 0.5 percent, with decliners beating risers 39 to 16 and 16 issues closing flat.
Sharpest main-tier losers were pulp and paper maker Celulosa, carmaker Ciadea and construction stock Polledo, which fell 6.0 percent, 2.1 percent and 1.8 percent, respectively.
The only MerVal gainers were Banco de Galicia, real estate developer Irsa and oil concern Astra, up 1.5 percent, 1.4 percent and 0.9 percent, respectively.
